Questions.Question: What was the name of the ship that brought the first indentured servants to America?
Questions.Explanation: The ship Jonathan arrived in the Virginia Colony in 1619 carrying the first documented indentured servants from England.

Questions.Question: Which group of immigrants were processed at Ellis Island?
Questions.Explanation: Ellis Island mainly processed European immigrants entering the United States from 1892 to 1924, with over 12 million arrivals.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the law that severely restricted Chinese immigration to the United States?
Questions.Explanation: The Chinese Exclusion Act was the first law to restrict a specific ethnic group from immigrating to the United States, enacted in 1882 and repealed in 1943.

Questions.Question: Which country did the majority of European immigrants come from during the peak years of immigration?
Questions.Explanation: Between 1880 and 1920, the majority of European immigrants to the United States were from Italy, due to economic hardship and political turmoil.

Questions.Question: What was the name of the immigration station on the west coast of the United States processing mainly Asian immigrants?
Questions.Explanation: Angel Island in San Francisco Bay was the immigration station processing mainly Asian immigrants, often subjecting them to harsh interrogations and detentions.
